comment: Her class began easy, likely due to my high school knowledge, but grew harder as the course progressed. She often seemed confused, even making mistakes during the lesson. If you did ask for help though she would help you. Even though she has the credentials there's still a barrier between her students and her style of teaching.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: I loved the class. The material was tedious but enjoyable. If I'm being honest, Dr. Babenko isn't the best professor. I didn't pay attention during class because sometimes I would get confused listening to her teach. I learned basically the entire course from the homework. Although the course material was fun (to an extent), pick another professor.

Do not take if u don't have strong calc fundamentals, she only goes over calc concepts if u r struggling. She explains the same concepts over n over so it does get a lil confusing, but understandable cuz the course is tough in general. Great feedback when u ask her during office hours, talks about her culture a lot but in a good way.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I learned by reading the textbook. She rambles and is always 5-10 mins late in a 50 min class. She derives equations then gives one example that isn't a get-the-concept example, it's just a full example. Imagine if we taught how to count by giving kids algebra, that's basically her and diffeq. Not a bad person, but not a good professor. KSU moment.

I met her during office hours and she was sweet. However, the class was hard and I didn't learn much by attending her class. In general, I didn't learn much throughout the semester. I wouldn't take her again.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: This professor doesn't know how to teach. All she does is give the class a worksheet and goes over the problems afterwards. She is very nice and will help if you ask her but it horrible at teaching the class. She even is often mixed up doing the problems on the board herself.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Babenko is defiantly not the best prof., but she isn't the worst either. Her lectures consist of print out notes she goes over. Not the best at answering questions though I asked for guidance and was basically told to just "think harder" about the problem. Test are VERY easy they are generated through ALEXS so doing the hw prepares you easily.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: DO. NOT. TAKE. HER. CLASS. She was the WORST teacher I have ever had. My biggest regret in college is taking her class. She does not teach, and on tests she expects everything to be done her way or it is wrong. She makes calculus 100000x harder, and she should not be teaching. SAVE YOURSELF WHILE YOU CAN AND RUN AS FAR AWAY FROM HER AS POSSIBLE!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: This is the worst professor I have ever had. I took her online, & she didn't even post her own lectures, but videos from other places. If you don't answer questions her exact way (which she won't walk through), you fail. Office hours are terrible. She becomes hostile if you try to question anything she does as a professor, if you can call her that.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: If you want to move on to the next course, do not take her class! She grades oddly, tests heavy and its her way or the highway! Even if you know another easier way she will not accept it. You MUST show HER way on all tests or get a grade of zero. There is also a lot of homework. She said I understand you have to work, but thats not my problem
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She does not give you any benefit of the doubt. She is very test heavy, and has a weird grading scale. Her homework load is immense, and she doesn't explain concepts very well. She will talk down to you if you ask a question she thinks you should already know the answer to. Her tests are crazy hard, and she doesn't give you any partial credit.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This professor was terrible. She teaches you the material but expects you to do it in her way even though her way did not make sense. The tests were ridiculously hard and she gave minimal to no credit if it wasn't her way. Overall avoid this professor at all costs. Trust this teacher was a pain no cap.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Decent professor. She is caring, yet very harsh. She does belittle students when they ask for clarification or about questions she doesn't care to answer. Save yourself the mental stress and take another professor. On track to get a B, but definitely should've recieved an A. She is the toughest grader ever and does not give students any benefit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Okay prof. I took her online for calc 2. Hard material of course, she knows what to do, but when someone would ask a basic question, she would kinda sigh or belittle the person in a way. It would happen sometimes. No quizzes online. Homework straight from the book. tests are okay, im doing okay at the moment. Definetly won't take again
Does not teach well, but when it comes to calc 2 profs she is not the worst choice. Lots is self-taught.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She was the hardest professor I have ever taken. She has a thick accent and is sometimes hard to understand. The class is already difficult and she doesn't explain very well. I probably only got a B due to her grading scale. I would try to avoid her, but if unable, the class is doable. Be prepared to work for a good grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. B knows her stuff and knows what she's doing but she expects way too much from her students. She talks exactly like a textbook and uses math terms you won't know. This was the hardest class taken not because of the material but because of the way the professor taught the class. There were two quizzes every class period and it was impossible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This was honestly one of the hardest classes I have taken. I have always been an exceptional math student. After taking her calc 2 class, I feel like I have been stripped down. She mimics the textbook throughout. She demands so much from her students. You have 2 quizzes every class period, one before and one after. PLEASE DONT TAKE THIS CLASS.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Tough teacher. Her lecturing style is on the boring side and you'll have a 4 question quiz every class period that sometimes has unreasonable questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Only take her class if ABSOLUTELY necessary; her grading scale does not make sense, she is pretty much unapproachable and will give the response "you should have learned this in Calc 1" to most questions. Her test are brutal and there is no study guide; at the end of every class there is 4 question quiz. The only cool thing about her is accent tbh.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Homework is high in volume and tests are challenging. She takes forever to grade anything and has lost tests. She was not conducive to learning at all. You can pass her class with above average effort. I'd recommend you take another challenging professor who won't make you feel utter disdain for the otherwise wonderful field of mathematics.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Shes Tough, Hardest C I ever had to work for. If you're not a good consistent student, don't take her. Her grading system is weird, but it's actually pretty fair. If you end up in her class because she's the only one left, work hard and stick it out. It'll pay off. Shes hard to talk to in class and office hours, so be brave.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Compliment sandwich with mostly the middle: She posts lecture notes, so if you miss a day or two you'll be able to catch up. She does not: give grades back in a timely manner (as in months), give good feedback, have good communication skills (very critical and standoffish to questions), have a clear grading scale. But she does give extra credit.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is a regular Calc2 course but she expects everyone to be an honor student math major. If you didn't ace your ACT in math, don't bother taking her. Seriously. Brilliant professor but the difficulty is out of this world. Last note - Class started with a full roster of like 45 kids, ended with 12 and of that, a few didn't even show for the final
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: IDK if it was the course or the professor but the class felt very demanding, IMO because of both factors. You definitely cannot get by just by understanding the concepts. You'll need to spend time understanding definitions for her exams and working difficult problems (also, the difficult ones are the only ones you'll usually run in to on exams).
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Hardest class i ever took. SERIOUSLY dont take her if you have another choice. her test are super hard. the weekly quizzes are killer. she makes a study guide for you for the tests but its completely different from the test.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Always thought I was good at math.  Dr. Babenko is rather strict when it comes to grading, and she chooses the hardest of problems to put on quizzes/tests. This is the first B I've ever had which will sadly ruin my 4.0, but I really thought I worked hard.. If u take her, do as MANY problems as u can.. hardly enough time for tests
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback

comment: Class seems somewhat easy at the beginning, but doesn't stay that way. That is most do to how hard calculus is, but she doesn't make it any easier by being a hard grader and expects you to memorize definitions of formulas. She does extra credit, but the could be hard to do if you are on a tight schedule. She will help you if you visit her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This was the most difficult class I've ever taken in college. Dr. B. is a wonderful teacher, but the material is very difficult, and she demands a lot from her students. There are quizzes every other class session, so attendance is critical to surviving. Brush up on trig functions and derivatives before the first day of class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She made Calc 2 way more difficult than it should have been.  She had the highest fail rate of any prof in the math department.  The tests were unnecessarily hard.  I did most of the homework but her tests were completely different.  Seriously don't take her unless you absolutely have to, and even then.

She loves Calculus, but seems to hate the students when it comes to asking questions. She is awful when it comes to grading as well. If you don't write EVERYTHING down, she won't give you points. Do not take her class unless you have no other option.

Dr. B is very enthusiastic about her work, she absolutely loves Calc2. She is very helpful during her office hours. The SI Leader she chose is extremely helpful and I would not have passed the class without her help. So many extra credit opportunities. If you're not willing to work for your A, do not take this class.

Be careful if you decide to take her because she is a very difficult teacher. She is condescending towards you when you ask a question even though she encourages them. There is a quiz every other class and its 2 questions and you get 5 minutes. Her tests are completely different from what she shows on quizzes and she gives little partial credit

She's a brilliant woman, but teaches like a text book and is demeaning to students. I am generally good at math, but her Calc 2 class killed me. She's rather frightening and will make you feel stupid for asking questions in class. This is coming from someone who usually asks numerous questions in every class. I would not take her again.

She will explain everything in her lectures perfectly fine and in a clear manner.   She says to ask questions, but then looks annoyed when you do.  Homework is a must and is reviewed by students in class and not her.  Quiz every other day.
Hardest class I have taken so far. You need to be prepared to work hard.

You'll have to know about CalcI well. She is very enthusiastic about math. Workload is high, but understandable. If you don't know your CalcI well, and ask lots of questions about fundamental stuff that a CalcII student should have already achieved long ago, she'll be pissed off naturally. You have to review those by yourself, but she'll help you.

Do NOT take her. She encourages students to ask questions, yet looks down on you and acts frustrated when you do so. She seems to not like the guys in her class for some reason. I always did homework, yet finished with a D in the class and had to retake calc 2. Quiz every other day, and only 5-8 minutes for 2 hard quiz questions...frustrating!

Such a hard class. Had a quiz every other class based purely on the book, so homework was mandatory if you wanted to pass. She sometimes looks down on you if you have questions, but she's improving. Goes over homework at the start of every class, quiz or not. She offers a good bit of extra credit. Okay class, her attitude can be lacking though.

The class is tough. About 50% dropped. The quizzes are really short (5-8 minutes for 2 questions) so you have to be on top of your homework. The tests are tough but not impossible. She hates questions in class, but if you go to her office hours she is very helpful. If you pass, you will be very good at calculus.

Take her at your own risk! She says she'll help but instead she puts students down when they ask questions. Therefore students stop asking questions for fear of embarrassment. I do not recommend her. You are left to figure things out on your own.

Not an easy class, but not too hard. Quiz every other day, based on hw. Test is a little bit long for the time. She is very nice teacher, and welcome to answer your question. However, u have to practice a lot to master the material. Grading scale helps a lot. Recommend for someone wanting to learn material.

Dr. B is SUCH a nice person, however she is VERY knowledgable so her course is difficult. She provides MANY extra credit opportunities, SI sessions, and office hours to help you though!! If you're willing to put in the extra time and effort she is a great teacher. Quizzes every other day help with your grade too!

Took her for Calc II. Awesome grading system. I took her MWF, so we had a quiz everyday over material from the previous class date and have HW presentations. She randomly calls (3-4) students to present a HW problem on the board. You'll go up to the board 3-4 times total. MOREOVER, she is a great teacher(moreover is her overly-used favorite word.

Shes a hard professor. If your looking for an easy A, this is not the place to be. Although if you work hard(do homework when it is assigned), chances are you'll walk out with an A or high B. Still she doesn't do the best job at explaining and youll need alot of online videos for help.(take her if its your last option)
Very hard class. I would not take her again!
I had her for Calc I and II. She is awesome. Others had difficulty (I guess b/c of the Eastern European accent, bluntness, and humor). I definitely recommend her. Daily quizzes help your grade.

I had her for Calc I and II.  Grading system is more than fair.  She is there to help you. Gives quizzes daily, so attendance in mandatory, but if forces you to keep up. Final exams are extremely difficult, but count the same as a test.

She is a great teacher! Her grading scale is out of 20 points and a 16-20 is an A. The Calculus II material is pretty difficult (mostly Chapter 6, in my opinion, the rest was not that bad). She is also there for office hours and does a great job explaining difficult material during the lexture class. Take her! Her grading scale is very very fair.
She's not a bad teacher. Occasionally the class gets confusing, but she's extremely helpful. I also recommend going to the SI sessions. Her grading system is AWESOME.
